get.description: Lists all of the user's applications.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entries to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries to return. Maximum page size is 500. Default is 100.

200.description: A list of the user applications.

post.description: Creates a new LUIS app.

requestBody.description: An application containing Name, Description (optional), Culture, Usage Scenario (optional), Domain (optional) and initial version ID (optional) of the application. Default value for the version ID is "0.1". Note: the culture cannot be changed after the app is created.

201.description: The ID of the created application.

get.description: Gets the endpoint URLs for the prebuilt Cortana applications.

200.description: A personal assistant apps JSON object containing the endpoint URLs for Cortana applications and the user's endpoint keys.

get.description: Gets a list of supported cultures. Cultures are equivalent to the written language and locale. For example,"en-us" represents the U.S. variation of English.

200.description: A list object containing the supported application cultures.

get.description: Gets all the available custom prebuilt domains for all cultures.

200.description: Returns a list of all custom prebuilt domains and their intents/entities representation.

post.description: Adds a prebuilt domain along with its intent and entity models as a new application.

requestBody.description: A prebuilt domain create object containing the name and culture of the domain.

201.description: The ID of the created application.

get.description: Gets all the available prebuilt domains for a specific culture.

200.description: Returns a list of all domains and their intents and entities for a specific culture.

get.description: Gets the available application domains.

200.description: A list object containing the available application domains.

post.description: Imports an application to LUIS, the application's structure is included in the request body.

parameters.name: appName
parameters.description: The application name to create. If not specified, the application name will be read from the imported object. If the application name already exists, an error is returned.

requestBody.description: A LUIS application structure.

201.description: The ID of the imported application.

get.description: Gets the application available usage scenarios.

200.description: A list object containing the available application usage scenarios.

get.description: Gets the application info.

put.description: Updates the name or description of the application.

requestBody.description: A model containing Name and Description of the application.

200.description: Successfully updated application name and description.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: A flag to indicate whether to force an operation.

get.summary: apps - Get LUIS Azure accounts assigned to the application
get.description: Gets the LUIS Azure accounts assigned to the application for the user using his ARM token.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The bearer authorization header to use; containing the user's ARM token used to validate Azure accounts information.

200.description: A list of azure account information objects.

post.summary: apps - Assign a LUIS Azure account to an application
post.description: Assigns an Azure account to the application.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The bearer authorization header to use; containing the user's ARM token used to validate Azure accounts information.

requestBody.description: The Azure account information object.

201.description: Successful operation.

delete.summary: apps - Removes an assigned LUIS Azure account from an application
delete.description: Removes assigned Azure account from the application.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The bearer authorization header to use; containing the user's ARM token used to validate Azure accounts information.

requestBody.description: The Azure account information object.

get.description: Returns the available endpoint deployment regions and URLs.

200.description: Returns a list of endpoints regions and their corresponding endpoint URL.

get.description: Gets the list of user emails that have permissions to access your application.

200.description: The list includes a single owner. All collaborators are listed in the emails array.

put.description: Replaces the current user access list with the new list sent in the body. If an empty list is sent, all access to other users will be removed.

requestBody.description: A model containing a list of user email addresses.

post.description: Adds a user to the allowed list of users to access this LUIS application. Users are added using their email address.

requestBody.description: A model containing the user's email address.

delete.description: Removes a user from the allowed list of users to access this LUIS application. Users are removed using their email address.

requestBody.description: A model containing the user's email address.

post.description: Publishes a specific version of the application.

requestBody.description: The application publish object. The region is the target region that the application is published to.

201.description: An object containing the application endpoint URL, its assigned endpoint key and publishing status.

207.description: An object containing the application endpoint URL, its assigned endpoint key and publishing status in case that publishing one or more regions failed.

get.description: Get the application publish settings including 'UseAllTrainingData'.

put.description: Updates the application publish settings including 'UseAllTrainingData'.

requestBody.description: An object containing the new publish application settings.

get.description: Gets the logs of the past month's endpoint queries for the application.

200.description: A CSV file containing the query logs for the past month.

schema.description: The query logs of an application for the past month in CSV format.

get.description: Get the application settings including 'UseAllTrainingData'.

requestBody.description: An object containing the new application settings.

get.description: Gets a list of versions for this application ID.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entries to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries to return. Maximum page size is 500. Default is 100.

200.description: A list of all versions of the application.

post.description: Imports a new version into a LUIS application.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: The new versionId to import. If not specified, the versionId will be read from the imported object.

requestBody.description: A LUIS application structure.

201.description: The created application version.

get.description: Gets the version information such as date created, last modified date, endpoint URL, count of intents and entities, training and publishing status.

200.description: A model containing the version info.

put.description: Updates the name or description of the application version.

requestBody.description: A model containing Name and Description of the application.

post.description: Creates a new version from the selected version.

requestBody.description: A model containing the new version ID.

201.description: The new version ID.

get.description: Gets information about all the list entity models in a version of the application.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entries to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries to return. Maximum page size is 500. Default is 100.

200.description: A list of list entity model infos.

post.description: Adds a list entity model to a version of the application.

requestBody.description: A model containing the name and words for the new list entity extractor.

201.description: The ID of the created model.

get.description: Gets information about a list entity in a version of the application.

put.description: Updates the list entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: The new list entity name and words list.

200.description: Successfully updated list entity name and words list.

delete.description: Deletes a list entity model from a version of the application.

200.description: Successfully delete list entity from a version of application.

patch.description: Adds a batch of sublists to an existing list entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: A words list batch.

200.description: Successfully added sublists to the list entity.

post.description: Adds a sublist to an existing list entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: Words list.

201.description: The ID of the newly created sublist.

put.description: Updates one of the list entity's sublists in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: A sublist update object containing the new canonical form and the list of words.

delete.description: Deletes a sublist of a specific list entity model from a version of the application.

get.summary: Get all roles for a list entity in a version of the application.

200.description: A list of the entity roles

post.summary: Create a role for a list entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: An entity role object containing the name of role.

201.description: The ID of the created entity role

get.summary: Get one role for a given list entity in a version of the application.

put.summary: Update a role for a given list entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: The new entity role.

delete.summary: Delete a role for a given list entity in a version of the application.

get.description: Gets information about all the composite entity models in a version of the application.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entries to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries to return. Maximum page size is 500. Default is 100.

200.description: A list of composite entity model infos.

get.description: Gets information about a composite entity in a version of the application.

put.description: Updates a composite entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: A model object containing the new entity extractor name and children.

delete.description: Deletes a composite entity from a version of the application.

post.description: Creates a single child in an existing composite entity model in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: A model object containing the name of the new composite child model.

201.description: The ID of the created model.

delete.description: Deletes a composite entity extractor child from a version of the application.

parameters.name: cChildId
parameters.description: The hierarchical entity extractor child ID.

get.summary: Get all roles for a composite entity in a version of the application

200.description: A list of the entity roles

post.summary: Create a role for a composite entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: An entity role object containing the name of role.

201.description: The ID of the created entity role

get.summary: Get one role for a given composite entity in a version of the application

put.summary: Update a role for a given composite entity in a version of the application

requestBody.description: The new entity role.

delete.summary: Delete a role for a given composite entity in a version of the application.

post.description: Adds a customizable prebuilt domain along with all of its intent and entity models in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: A prebuilt domain create object containing the name of the domain.

201.description: An array of the created customizable prebuilt domain intent and entity model Ids.

delete.description: Deletes a prebuilt domain's models in a version of the application.

get.description: Gets all prebuilt entities used in a version of the application.

200.description: Returns a list of all prebuilt entities and their representations.

post.description: Adds a prebuilt entity model to a version of the application.

requestBody.description: A model object containing the name of the prebuilt entity and the name of the domain to which this model belongs.

201.description: The ID of the created prebuilt model.

get.summary: Get all roles for a prebuilt entity in a version of the application

200.description: A list of the entity roles

post.summary: Create a role for a prebuilt entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: An entity role object containing the name of role.

201.description: The ID of the created entity role

get.summary: Get one role for a given prebuilt entity in a version of the application.

put.summary: Update a role for a given prebuilt entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: The new entity role.

delete.summary: Delete a role for a given prebuilt entity in a version of the application.

get.description: Gets information about customizable prebuilt intents added to a version of the application.

200.description: Returns a list of all customizable prebuilt intents and their representations in a version of the application.

post.description: Adds a customizable prebuilt intent model to a version of the application.

requestBody.description: A model object containing the name of the customizable prebuilt intent and the name of the domain to which this model belongs.

201.description: The ID of the created intent model.

get.description: Gets all prebuilt intent and entity model information used in a version of this application.

200.description: Returns a list of all prebuilt models and their representations.

requestBody.description: A model object containing the name new entity extractor or the name and instance of model of a child entity extractor

200.description: A list of feature information objects for the entity.

put.description: Updates the information of the features used by the entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: A list of feature information objects containing the new feature relations.

post.description: Adds a new feature relation to be used by the entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: A Feature relation information object.

delete.description: Deletes a relation from the feature relations used by the entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: A feature information object containing the feature relation to delete.

get.summary: Get all roles for an entity in a version of the application

200.description: A list of the entity roles

post.summary: Create an entity role in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: An entity role object containing the name of role.

201.description: The ID of the created entity role

put.summary: Update a role for a given entity in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: The new entity role.

delete.summary: Delete an entity role in a version of the application.

get.description: Get suggested example utterances that would improve the accuracy of the entity model in a version of the application.

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: The target entity extractor model to enhance.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries to return. Maximum page size is 500. Default is 100.

200.description: If there's no trained entity model, nothing is returned in the response. If there's a trained model and active learning finds any relevant queries, they are returned with the entity model predictions. If there's a trained model but active learning didn't find any relevant queries, an empty list is returned in the response.

post.description: Adds a labeled example utterance in a version of the application.

requestBody.description: A labeled example utterance with the expected intent and entities.

201.description: The ID of the created example utterance.

get.description: Returns example utterances to be reviewed from a version of the application.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entries to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries to return. Maximum page size is 500. Default is 100.

200.description: A list of predictions and label pairs for every example utterance in the application.

post.description: Adds a batch of labeled example utterances to a version of the application.

requestBody.description: Array of example utterances.

201.description: A string array determining which labeled example utterances were added successfully.

207.description: Indicates that the request was partially successful. The response contains a string array indicating the status of each of the added labeled example utterances.

delete.description: Deletes the labeled example utterances with the specified ID from a version of the application.

get.description: Exports a LUIS application to JSON format.

get.description: Gets the training status of all models (intents and entities) for the specified LUIS app. You must call the train API to train the LUIS app before you call this API to get training status. "appID" specifies the LUIS app ID. "versionId" specifies the version number of the LUIS app. For example, "0.1".

200.description: A successful response provides an array of training status details for a LUIS app that you submitted for training. Each element in the response array provides training status for a model (intent or entity) in the LUIS app. Note: Training status is not provided for prebuilt entities because they are pretrained. The "modelId" property identifies which intent or entity the training status corresponds to. To get the name and type of each model, use the models API which has a request URL in this format: https://westus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com/luis/api/v3.0-preview/apps/{appId}/versions/{versionId}/models The details property for each model can contain the following fields: "statusId": An integer from 0 to 3 that corresponds to the value of the status field. "status": A string with one of the following values: "Success", "UpToDate", "InProgress", "Fail". If the status is "Fail", the "failureReason" property provides the reason for failure. "exampleCount": The number of examples used for training. In the case of the None intent or prebuilt domain intents and entities, this number includes example provided internally by the system as well as examples you added to your LUIS app. "failureReason": A string that indicates the reason training failed.  The value "FewLabels" means that no labeled example utterances were provided for training. "trainingDateTime": A string indicating the time the model was last trained. The value uses the ISO 8601 format for representing times in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) with a UTC designator ("Z"), for example: "2017-08-10T01:08:34Z".

post.description: Sends a training request for a version of a specified LUIS app. This POST request initiates a request asynchronously. To determine whether the training request is successful, submit a GET request to get training status. Note: The application version is not fully trained unless all the models (intents and entities) are trained successfully or are up to date. To verify training success, get the training status at least once after training is complete.

202.description: This response indicates the initial training status.

mode.description: An interchangeable phrase list feature serves as a list of synonyms for training. A non-exchangeable phrase list serves as separate features for training. So, if your non-interchangeable phrase list contains 5 phrases, they will be mapped to 5 separate features. You can think of the non-interchangeable phrase list as an additional bag of words to add to LUIS existing vocabulary features. It is used as a lexicon lookup feature where its value is 1 if the lexicon contains a given word or 0 if it doesnt.  Default value is true.

PersonalAssistantUrls.description: Endpoint URLs for prebuilt Cortana applications.

PersonalAssistantsResponse.description: Response containing user's endpoint keys and the endpoint URLs of the prebuilt Cortana applications.

isExchangeable.description: An exchangeable phrase list feature are serves as single feature to the LUIS underlying training algorithm. It is used as a lexicon lookup feature where its value is 1 if the lexicon contains a given word or 0 if it doesnt. Think of an exchangeable as a synonyms list. A non-exchangeable phrase list feature has all the phrases in the list serve as separate features to the underlying training algorithm. So, if you your phrase list feature contains 5 phrases, they will be mapped to 5 separate features. You can think of the non-exchangeable phrase list feature as an additional bag of words that you are willing to add to LUIS existing vocabulary features. Think of a non-exchangeable as set of different words. Default value is true.

enabledForAllModels.description: Indicates if the Phraselist is enabled for all models in the application.

isExchangeable.description: An interchangeable phrase list feature serves as a list of synonyms for training. A non-exchangeable phrase list serves as separate features for training. So, if your non-interchangeable phrase list contains 5 phrases, they will be mapped to 5 separate features. You can think of the non-interchangeable phrase list as an additional bag of words to add to LUIS existing vocabulary features. It is used as a lexicon lookup feature where its value is 1 if the lexicon contains a given word or 0 if it doesnt.  Default value is true.

A non-exchangeable phrase list feature has all the phrases in the list serve as separate features to the underlying training algorithm.
